25/*
26 * GK20A does not have dedicated video memory, and to accurately represent this
27 * fact Nouveau will not create a RAM device for it. Therefore its instmem
28 * implementation must be done directly on top of system memory, while
29 * preserving coherency for read and write operations.
30 *
31 * Instmem can be allocated through two means:
32 * 1) If an IOMMU unit has been probed, the IOMMU API is used to make memory
33 * pages contiguous to the GPU. This is the preferred way.
34 * 2) If no IOMMU unit is probed, the DMA API is used to allocate physically
35 * contiguous memory.
36 *
37 * In both cases CPU read and writes are performed by creating a write-combined
38 * mapping. The GPU L2 cache must thus be flushed/invalidated when required. To
39 * be conservative we do this every time we acquire or release an instobj, but
40 * ideally L2 management should be handled at a higher level.
41 *
42 * To improve performance, CPU mappings are not removed upon instobj release.
43 * Instead they are placed into a LRU list to be recycled when the mapped space
44 * goes beyond a certain threshold. At the moment this limit is 1MB.
45 */
46#include <sys/cdefs.h>
47__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: nouveau_nvkm_subdev_instmem_gk20a.c,v 1.4 2018/08/27 07:36:37 riastradh Exp $");
48
49#include "priv.h"
50
51#include <core/memory.h>
52#include <core/mm.h>
53#include <core/tegra.h>
54#include <subdev/fb.h>
55#include <subdev/ltc.h>
56
57#ifdef __NetBSD__
58# define __iomem __nvkm_memory_iomem
59#endif
60
61struct gk20a_instobj {
62 struct nvkm_memory memory;
63 struct nvkm_mem mem;
64 struct gk20a_instmem *imem;
65
66 /* CPU mapping */
67 u32 *vaddr;
68 struct list_head vaddr_node;
69};
70#define gk20a_instobj(p) container_of((p), struct gk20a_instobj, memory)
71
72#ifdef __NetBSD__
73
74struct gk20a_instobj_netbsd {
75 struct gk20a_instobj base;
76
77 bus_dma_segment_t *segs;
78 int nsegs;
79 bus_dmamap_t map;
80};
81#define gk20a_instobj_netbsd(p) \
82 container_of(gk20a_instobj(p), struct gk20a_instobj_netbsd, base)
83
84#else
85
86/*
87 * Used for objects allocated using the DMA API
88 */
89struct gk20a_instobj_dma {
90 struct gk20a_instobj base;
91
92 u32 *cpuaddr;
93 dma_addr_t handle;
94 struct nvkm_mm_node r;
95};
96#define gk20a_instobj_dma(p) \
97 container_of(gk20a_instobj(p), struct gk20a_instobj_dma, base)
98
99/*
100 * Used for objects flattened using the IOMMU API
101 */
102struct gk20a_instobj_iommu {
103 struct gk20a_instobj base;
104
105 /* will point to the higher half of pages */
106 dma_addr_t *dma_addrs;
107 /* array of base.mem->size pages (+ dma_addr_ts) */
108 struct page *pages[];
109};
110#define gk20a_instobj_iommu(p) \
111 container_of(gk20a_instobj(p), struct gk20a_instobj_iommu, base)
112
113#endif /* __NetBSD__ */
114
115struct gk20a_instmem {
116 struct nvkm_instmem base;
117
118 /* protects vaddr_* and gk20a_instobj::vaddr* */
119 spinlock_t lock;
120
121 /* CPU mappings LRU */
122 unsigned int vaddr_use;
123 unsigned int vaddr_max;
124 struct list_head vaddr_lru;
125
126#ifndef __NetBSD__
127 /* Only used if IOMMU if present */
128 struct mutex *mm_mutex;
129 struct nvkm_mm *mm;
130 struct iommu_domain *domain;
131 unsigned long iommu_pgshift;
132 u16 iommu_bit;
133
134 /* Only used by DMA API */
135 struct dma_attrs attrs;
136#endif
137
138 void __iomem * (*cpu_map)(struct nvkm_memory *);
139};
140#define gk20a_instmem(p) container_of((p), struct gk20a_instmem, base)
141
142static enum nvkm_memory_target
143gk20a_instobj_target(struct nvkm_memory *memory)
144{
145 return NVKM_MEM_TARGET_HOST;
146}
147
148static u64
149gk20a_instobj_addr(struct nvkm_memory *memory)
150{
151 return gk20a_instobj(memory)->mem.offset;
152}
153
154static u64
155gk20a_instobj_size(struct nvkm_memory *memory)
156{
157 return (u64)gk20a_instobj(memory)->mem.size << 12;
158}
159
160#ifdef __NetBSD__
161
162static void __iomem *
163gk20a_instobj_cpu_map_netbsd(struct nvkm_memory *memory)
164{
165 struct gk20a_instobj_netbsd *node = gk20a_instobj_netbsd(memory);
166 struct nvkm_device *device = node->base.imem->base.subdev.device;
167 bus_dma_tag_t dmat = device->func->dma_tag(device);
168 uint64_t nbytes = nvkm_memory_size(memory);
169 void *kva;
170 int ret;
171
172 /* XXX errno NetBSD->Linux */
173 ret = -bus_dmamem_map(dmat, node->segs, node->nsegs, nbytes, &kva,
174 BUS_DMA_WAITOK);
175 if (ret)
176 return NULL;
177
178 return kva;
179}
180
181static void
182gk20a_instobj_cpu_unmap_netbsd(struct nvkm_memory *memory, void *kva)
183{
184 struct gk20a_instobj_netbsd *node = gk20a_instobj_netbsd(memory);
185 struct nvkm_device *device = node->base.imem->base.subdev.device;
186 bus_dma_tag_t dmat = device->func->dma_tag(device);
187
188 bus_dmamem_unmap(dmat, kva, nvkm_memory_size(memory));
189}
190
191#else
192
193static void __iomem *
194gk20a_instobj_cpu_map_dma(struct nvkm_memory *memory)
195{
196#if defined(CONFIG_ARM) || defined(CONFIG_ARM64)
197 struct gk20a_instobj_dma *node = gk20a_instobj_dma(memory);
198 struct device *dev = node->base.imem->base.subdev.device->dev;
199 int npages = nvkm_memory_size(memory) >> 12;
200 struct page *pages[npages];
201 int i;
202
203 /* we shouldn't see a gk20a on anything but arm/arm64 anyways */
204 /* phys_to_page does not exist on all platforms... */
205 pages[0] = pfn_to_page(dma_to_phys(dev, node->handle) >> PAGE_SHIFT);
206 for (i = 1; i < npages; i++)
207 pages[i] = pages[0] + i;
208
209 return vmap(pages, npages, VM_MAP, pgprot_writecombine(PAGE_KERNEL));
210#else
211 BUG();
212 return NULL;
213#endif
214}
215
216static void __iomem *
217gk20a_instobj_cpu_map_iommu(struct nvkm_memory *memory)
218{
219 struct gk20a_instobj_iommu *node = gk20a_instobj_iommu(memory);
220 int npages = nvkm_memory_size(memory) >> 12;
221
222 return vmap(node->pages, npages, VM_MAP,
223 pgprot_writecombine(PAGE_KERNEL));
224}
225
226#endif /* __NetBSD__ */
227
228/*
229 * Must be called while holding gk20a_instmem_lock
230 */
231static void
232gk20a_instmem_vaddr_gc(struct gk20a_instmem *imem, const u64 size)
233{
234 while (imem->vaddr_use + size > imem->vaddr_max) {
235 struct gk20a_instobj *obj;
236
237 /* no candidate that can be unmapped, abort... */
238 if (list_empty(&imem->vaddr_lru))
239 break;
240
241 obj = list_first_entry(&imem->vaddr_lru, struct gk20a_instobj,
242 vaddr_node);
243 list_del(&obj->vaddr_node);
244#ifdef __NetBSD__
245 gk20a_instobj_cpu_unmap_netbsd(&obj->memory, obj->vaddr);
246#else
247 vunmap(obj->vaddr);
248#endif
249 obj->vaddr = NULL;
250 imem->vaddr_use -= nvkm_memory_size(&obj->memory);
251 nvkm_debug(&imem->base.subdev, "(GC) vaddr used: %x/%x\n",
252 imem->vaddr_use, imem->vaddr_max);
253
254 }
255}
256
257static void __iomem *
258gk20a_instobj_acquire(struct nvkm_memory *memory)
259{
260 struct gk20a_instobj *node = gk20a_instobj(memory);
261 struct gk20a_instmem *imem = node->imem;
262 struct nvkm_ltc *ltc = imem->base.subdev.device->ltc;
263 const u64 size = nvkm_memory_size(memory);
264 unsigned long flags;
265
266 nvkm_ltc_flush(ltc);
267
268 spin_lock_irqsave(&imem->lock, flags);
269
270 if (node->vaddr) {
271 /* remove us from the LRU list since we cannot be unmapped */
272 list_del(&node->vaddr_node);
273
274 goto out;
275 }
276
277 /* try to free some address space if we reached the limit */
278 gk20a_instmem_vaddr_gc(imem, size);
279
280 node->vaddr = imem->cpu_map(memory);
281
282 if (!node->vaddr) {
283 nvkm_error(&imem->base.subdev, "cannot map instobj - "
284 "this is not going to end well...\n");
285 goto out;
286 }
287
288 imem->vaddr_use += size;
289 nvkm_debug(&imem->base.subdev, "vaddr used: %x/%x\n",
290 imem->vaddr_use, imem->vaddr_max);
291
292out:
293 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&imem->lock, flags);
294
295 return node->vaddr;
296}
297
298static void
299gk20a_instobj_release(struct nvkm_memory *memory)
300{
301 struct gk20a_instobj *node = gk20a_instobj(memory);
302 struct gk20a_instmem *imem = node->imem;
303 struct nvkm_ltc *ltc = imem->base.subdev.device->ltc;
304 unsigned long flags;
305
306 spin_lock_irqsave(&imem->lock, flags);
307
308 /* add ourselves to the LRU list so our CPU mapping can be freed */
309 list_add_tail(&node->vaddr_node, &imem->vaddr_lru);
310
311 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&imem->lock, flags);
312
313 wmb();
314 nvkm_ltc_invalidate(ltc);
315}
316
317static u32
318gk20a_instobj_rd32(struct nvkm_memory *memory, u64 offset)
319{
320 struct gk20a_instobj *node = gk20a_instobj(memory);
321
322 return node->vaddr[offset / 4];
323}
324
325static void
326gk20a_instobj_wr32(struct nvkm_memory *memory, u64 offset, u32 data)
327{
328 struct gk20a_instobj *node = gk20a_instobj(memory);
329
330 node->vaddr[offset / 4] = data;
331}
332
333static void
334gk20a_instobj_map(struct nvkm_memory *memory, struct nvkm_vma *vma, u64 offset)
335{
336 struct gk20a_instobj *node = gk20a_instobj(memory);
337
338 nvkm_vm_map_at(vma, offset, &node->mem);
339}
340
341/*
342 * Clear the CPU mapping of an instobj if it exists
343 */
344static void
345gk20a_instobj_dtor(struct gk20a_instobj *node)
346{
347 struct gk20a_instmem *imem = node->imem;
348 struct gk20a_instobj *obj;
349 unsigned long flags;
350
351 spin_lock_irqsave(&imem->lock, flags);
352
353 if (!node->vaddr)
354 goto out;
355
356 list_for_each_entry(obj, &imem->vaddr_lru, vaddr_node) {
357 if (obj == node) {
358 list_del(&obj->vaddr_node);
359 break;
360 }
361 }
362#ifdef __NetBSD__
363 gk20a_instobj_cpu_unmap_netbsd(&node->memory, node->vaddr);
364#else
365 vunmap(node->vaddr);
366#endif
367 node->vaddr = NULL;
368 imem->vaddr_use -= nvkm_memory_size(&node->memory);
369 nvkm_debug(&imem->base.subdev, "vaddr used: %x/%x\n",
370 imem->vaddr_use, imem->vaddr_max);
371
372out:
373 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&imem->lock, flags);
374}
375
376#ifdef __NetBSD__
377
378static void *
379gk20a_instobj_dtor_netbsd(struct nvkm_memory *memory)
380{
381 struct gk20a_instobj_netbsd *node = gk20a_instobj_netbsd(memory);
382 struct gk20a_instmem *imem = node->base.imem;
383 struct nvkm_device *device = imem->base.subdev.device;
384 bus_dma_tag_t dmat = device->func->dma_tag(device);
385
386 gk20a_instobj_dtor(&node->base);
387
388 if (unlikely(!node->map))
389 goto out;
390
391 bus_dmamap_unload(dmat, node->map);
392 bus_dmamap_destroy(dmat, node->map);
393 bus_dmamem_free(dmat, node->segs, nvkm_memory_size(memory));
394
395out:
396 return node;
397}
398
399#else
400
401static void *
402gk20a_instobj_dtor_dma(struct nvkm_memory *memory)
403{
404 struct gk20a_instobj_dma *node = gk20a_instobj_dma(memory);
405 struct gk20a_instmem *imem = node->base.imem;
406 struct device *dev = imem->base.subdev.device->dev;
407
408 gk20a_instobj_dtor(&node->base);
409
410 if (unlikely(!node->cpuaddr))
411 goto out;
412
413 dma_free_attrs(dev, node->base.mem.size << PAGE_SHIFT, node->cpuaddr,
414 node->handle, &imem->attrs);
415
416out:
417 return node;
418}
419
420static void *
421gk20a_instobj_dtor_iommu(struct nvkm_memory *memory)
422{
423 struct gk20a_instobj_iommu *node = gk20a_instobj_iommu(memory);
424 struct gk20a_instmem *imem = node->base.imem;
425 struct device *dev = imem->base.subdev.device->dev;
426 struct nvkm_mm_node *r;
427 int i;
428
429 gk20a_instobj_dtor(&node->base);
430
431 if (unlikely(list_empty(&node->base.mem.regions)))
432 goto out;
433
434 r = list_first_entry(&node->base.mem.regions, struct nvkm_mm_node,
435 rl_entry);
436
437 /* clear IOMMU bit to unmap pages */
438 r->offset &= ~BIT(imem->iommu_bit - imem->iommu_pgshift);
439
440 /* Unmap pages from GPU address space and free them */
441 for (i = 0; i < node->base.mem.size; i++) {
442 iommu_unmap(imem->domain,
443 (r->offset + i) << imem->iommu_pgshift, PAGE_SIZE);
444 dma_unmap_page(dev, node->dma_addrs[i], PAGE_SIZE,
445 DMA_BIDIRECTIONAL);
446 __free_page(node->pages[i]);
447 }
448
449 /* Release area from GPU address space */
450 mutex_lock(imem->mm_mutex);
451 nvkm_mm_free(imem->mm, &r);
452 mutex_unlock(imem->mm_mutex);
453
454out:
455 return node;
456}
457
458#endif /* __NetBSD__ */
459
460#ifdef __NetBSD__
461
462static const struct nvkm_memory_func
463gk20a_instobj_func_netbsd = {
464 .dtor = gk20a_instobj_dtor_netbsd,
465 .target = gk20a_instobj_target,
466 .addr = gk20a_instobj_addr,
467 .size = gk20a_instobj_size,
468 .acquire = gk20a_instobj_acquire,
469 .release = gk20a_instobj_release,
470 .rd32 = gk20a_instobj_rd32,
471 .wr32 = gk20a_instobj_wr32,
472 .map = gk20a_instobj_map,
473};
474
475#else
476
477static const struct nvkm_memory_func
478gk20a_instobj_func_dma = {
479 .dtor = gk20a_instobj_dtor_dma,
480 .target = gk20a_instobj_target,
481 .addr = gk20a_instobj_addr,
482 .size = gk20a_instobj_size,
483 .acquire = gk20a_instobj_acquire,
484 .release = gk20a_instobj_release,
485 .rd32 = gk20a_instobj_rd32,
486 .wr32 = gk20a_instobj_wr32,
487 .map = gk20a_instobj_map,
488};
489
490static const struct nvkm_memory_func
491gk20a_instobj_func_iommu = {
492 .dtor = gk20a_instobj_dtor_iommu,
493 .target = gk20a_instobj_target,
494 .addr = gk20a_instobj_addr,
495 .size = gk20a_instobj_size,
496 .acquire = gk20a_instobj_acquire,
497 .release = gk20a_instobj_release,
498 .rd32 = gk20a_instobj_rd32,
499 .wr32 = gk20a_instobj_wr32,
500 .map = gk20a_instobj_map,
501};
502
503#endif
504
505#ifdef __NetBSD__
506
507static int
508gk20a_instobj_ctor_netbsd(struct gk20a_instmem *imem, u32 pages, u32 align,
509 struct gk20a_instobj **_node)
510{
511 struct gk20a_instobj_netbsd *node;
512 struct nvkm_subdev *subdev = &imem->base.subdev;
513 struct nvkm_device *device = subdev->device;
514 bus_dma_tag_t dmat = device->func->dma_tag(device);
515 bus_size_t nbytes = (bus_size_t)pages << PAGE_SHIFT;
516 int ret;
517
518 if (!(node = kzalloc(sizeof(*node), GFP_KERNEL))) {
519 ret = -ENOMEM;
520fail0: return ret;
521 }
522 *_node = &node->base;
523
524 nvkm_memory_ctor(&gk20a_instobj_func_netbsd, &node->base.memory);
525
526 node->segs = kcalloc(pages, sizeof(node->segs[0]), GFP_KERNEL);
527 if (node->segs == NULL) {
528 ret = -ENOMEM;
529 goto fail0;
530 }
531
532 ret = -bus_dmamem_alloc(dmat, nbytes, align, 0, node->segs, pages,
533 &node->nsegs, BUS_DMA_WAITOK);
534 if (ret) {
535 kfree(node->segs);
536 node->segs = NULL;
537fail1: goto fail0;
538 }
539 KASSERT(0 <= node->nsegs);
540 KASSERT(node->nsegs <= pages);
541
542 /*
543 * Must be a contiguous address range in bus space, so maxsegsz
544 * is the full mapping size.
545 */
546 ret = -bus_dmamap_create(dmat, nbytes, node->nsegs, nbytes, 0,
547 BUS_DMA_WAITOK, &node->map);
548 if (ret) {
549fail2: bus_dmamem_free(dmat, node->segs, node->nsegs);
550 goto fail1;
551 }
552
553 ret = -bus_dmamap_load_raw(dmat, node->map, node->segs, node->nsegs,
554 nbytes, BUS_DMA_WAITOK);
555 if (ret) {
556fail3: __unused
557 bus_dmamap_destroy(dmat, node->map);
558 node->map = NULL;
559 goto fail2;
560 }
561
562 /* Success! */
563 return 0;
564}
565
566#else
567
568static int
569gk20a_instobj_ctor_dma(struct gk20a_instmem *imem, u32 npages, u32 align,
570 struct gk20a_instobj **_node)
571{
572 struct gk20a_instobj_dma *node;
573 struct nvkm_subdev *subdev = &imem->base.subdev;
574 struct device *dev = subdev->device->dev;
575
576 if (!(node = kzalloc(sizeof(*node), GFP_KERNEL)))
577 return -ENOMEM;
578 *_node = &node->base;
579
580 nvkm_memory_ctor(&gk20a_instobj_func_dma, &node->base.memory);
581
582 node->cpuaddr = dma_alloc_attrs(dev, npages << PAGE_SHIFT,
583 &node->handle, GFP_KERNEL,
584 &imem->attrs);
585 if (!node->cpuaddr) {
586 nvkm_error(subdev, "cannot allocate DMA memory\n");
587 return -ENOMEM;
588 }
589
590 /* alignment check */
591 if (unlikely(node->handle & (align - 1)))
592 nvkm_warn(subdev,
593 "memory not aligned as requested: %pad (0x%x)\n",
594 &node->handle, align);
595
596 /* present memory for being mapped using small pages */
597 node->r.type = 12;
598 node->r.offset = node->handle >> 12;
599 node->r.length = (npages << PAGE_SHIFT) >> 12;
600
601 node->base.mem.offset = node->handle;
602
603 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&node->base.mem.regions);
604 list_add_tail(&node->r.rl_entry, &node->base.mem.regions);
605
606 return 0;
607}
608
609static int
610gk20a_instobj_ctor_iommu(struct gk20a_instmem *imem, u32 npages, u32 align,
611 struct gk20a_instobj **_node)
612{
613 struct gk20a_instobj_iommu *node;
614 struct nvkm_subdev *subdev = &imem->base.subdev;
615 struct device *dev = subdev->device->dev;
616 struct nvkm_mm_node *r;
617 int ret;
618 int i;
619
620 /*
621 * despite their variable size, instmem allocations are small enough
622 * (< 1 page) to be handled by kzalloc
623 */
624 if (!(node = kzalloc(sizeof(*node) + ((sizeof(node->pages[0]) +
625 sizeof(*node->dma_addrs)) * npages), GFP_KERNEL)))
626 return -ENOMEM;
627 *_node = &node->base;
628 node->dma_addrs = (void *)(node->pages + npages);
629
630 nvkm_memory_ctor(&gk20a_instobj_func_iommu, &node->base.memory);
631
632 /* Allocate backing memory */
633 for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
634 struct page *p = alloc_page(GFP_KERNEL);
635 dma_addr_t dma_adr;
636
637 if (p == NULL) {
638 ret = -ENOMEM;
639 goto free_pages;
640 }
641 node->pages[i] = p;
642 dma_adr = dma_map_page(dev, p, 0, PAGE_SIZE, DMA_BIDIRECTIONAL);
643 if (dma_mapping_error(dev, dma_adr)) {
644 nvkm_error(subdev, "DMA mapping error!\n");
645 ret = -ENOMEM;
646 goto free_pages;
647 }
648 node->dma_addrs[i] = dma_adr;
649 }
650
651 mutex_lock(imem->mm_mutex);
652 /* Reserve area from GPU address space */
653 ret = nvkm_mm_head(imem->mm, 0, 1, npages, npages,
654 align >> imem->iommu_pgshift, &r);
655 mutex_unlock(imem->mm_mutex);
656 if (ret) {
657 nvkm_error(subdev, "IOMMU space is full!\n");
658 goto free_pages;
659 }
660
661 /* Map into GPU address space */
662 for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
663 u32 offset = (r->offset + i) << imem->iommu_pgshift;
664
665 ret = iommu_map(imem->domain, offset, node->dma_addrs[i],
666 PAGE_SIZE, IOMMU_READ | IOMMU_WRITE);
667 if (ret < 0) {
668 nvkm_error(subdev, "IOMMU mapping failure: %d\n", ret);
669
670 while (i-- > 0) {
671 offset -= PAGE_SIZE;
672 iommu_unmap(imem->domain, offset, PAGE_SIZE);
673 }
674 goto release_area;
675 }
676 }
677
678 /* IOMMU bit tells that an address is to be resolved through the IOMMU */
679 r->offset |= BIT(imem->iommu_bit - imem->iommu_pgshift);
680
681 node->base.mem.offset = ((u64)r->offset) << imem->iommu_pgshift;
682
683 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&node->base.mem.regions);
684 list_add_tail(&r->rl_entry, &node->base.mem.regions);
685
686 return 0;
687
688release_area:
689 mutex_lock(imem->mm_mutex);
690 nvkm_mm_free(imem->mm, &r);
691 mutex_unlock(imem->mm_mutex);
692
693free_pages:
694 for (i = 0; i < npages && node->pages[i] != NULL; i++) {
695 dma_addr_t dma_addr = node->dma_addrs[i];
696 if (dma_addr)
697 dma_unmap_page(dev, dma_addr, PAGE_SIZE,
698 DMA_BIDIRECTIONAL);
699 __free_page(node->pages[i]);
700 }
701
702 return ret;
703}
704
705#endif /* __NetBSD__ */
706
707static int
708gk20a_instobj_new(struct nvkm_instmem *base, u32 size, u32 align, bool zero,
709 struct nvkm_memory **pmemory)
710{
711 struct gk20a_instmem *imem = gk20a_instmem(base);
712 struct nvkm_subdev *subdev = &imem->base.subdev;
713 struct gk20a_instobj *node = NULL;
714 int ret = 0;
715
716#ifdef __NetBSD__
717 nvkm_debug(subdev, "%s (%s): size: %x align: %x\n", __func__,
718 "bus_dma", size, align);
719#else
720 nvkm_debug(subdev, "%s (%s): size: %x align: %x\n", __func__,
721 imem->domain ? "IOMMU" : "DMA", size, align);
722#endif
723
724 /* Round size and align to page bounds */
725 size = max(roundup(size, PAGE_SIZE), PAGE_SIZE);
726 align = max(roundup(align, PAGE_SIZE), PAGE_SIZE);
727
728#ifdef __NetBSD__
729 ret = gk20a_instobj_ctor_netbsd(imem, size >> PAGE_SHIFT, align,
730 &node);
731#else
732 if (imem->domain)
733 ret = gk20a_instobj_ctor_iommu(imem, size >> PAGE_SHIFT,
734 align, &node);
735 else
736 ret = gk20a_instobj_ctor_dma(imem, size >> PAGE_SHIFT,
737 align, &node);
738#endif
739 *pmemory = node ? &node->memory : NULL;
740 if (ret)
741 return ret;
742
743 node->imem = imem;
744
745 /* present memory for being mapped using small pages */
746 node->mem.size = size >> 12;
747 node->mem.memtype = 0;
748 node->mem.page_shift = 12;
749
750 nvkm_debug(subdev, "alloc size: 0x%x, align: 0x%x, gaddr: 0x%"PRIx64"\n",
751 size, align, node->mem.offset);
752
753 return 0;
754}
755
756static void *
757gk20a_instmem_dtor(struct nvkm_instmem *base)
758{
759 struct gk20a_instmem *imem = gk20a_instmem(base);
760
761 /* perform some sanity checks... */
762 if (!list_empty(&imem->vaddr_lru))
763 nvkm_warn(&base->subdev, "instobj LRU not empty!\n");
764
765 if (imem->vaddr_use != 0)
766 nvkm_warn(&base->subdev, "instobj vmap area not empty! "
767 "0x%x bytes still mapped\n", imem->vaddr_use);
768
769 return imem;
770}
771
772static const struct nvkm_instmem_func
773gk20a_instmem = {
774 .dtor = gk20a_instmem_dtor,
775 .memory_new = gk20a_instobj_new,
776 .persistent = true,
777 .zero = false,
778};
779
780int
781gk20a_instmem_new(struct nvkm_device *device, int index,
782 struct nvkm_instmem **pimem)
783{
784#ifndef __NetBSD__
785 struct nvkm_device_tegra *tdev = device->func->tegra(device);
786#endif
787 struct gk20a_instmem *imem;
788
789 if (!(imem = kzalloc(sizeof(*imem), GFP_KERNEL)))
790 return -ENOMEM;
791 nvkm_instmem_ctor(&gk20a_instmem, device, index, &imem->base);
792 spin_lock_init(&imem->lock);
793 *pimem = &imem->base;
794
795 /* do not allow more than 1MB of CPU-mapped instmem */
796 imem->vaddr_use = 0;
797 imem->vaddr_max = 0x100000;
798 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&imem->vaddr_lru);
799
800#ifdef __NetBSD__
801 imem->cpu_map = gk20a_instobj_cpu_map_netbsd;
802 nvkm_info(&imem->base.subdev, "using bus_dma\n");
803#else
804 if (tdev->iommu.domain) {
805 imem->mm_mutex = &tdev->iommu.mutex;
806 imem->mm = &tdev->iommu.mm;
807 imem->domain = tdev->iommu.domain;
808 imem->iommu_pgshift = tdev->iommu.pgshift;
809 imem->cpu_map = gk20a_instobj_cpu_map_iommu;
810 imem->iommu_bit = tdev->func->iommu_bit;
811
812 nvkm_info(&imem->base.subdev, "using IOMMU\n");
813 } else {
814 init_dma_attrs(&imem->attrs);
815 /* We will access the memory through our own mapping */
816 dma_set_attr(DMA_ATTR_NON_CONSISTENT, &imem->attrs);
817 dma_set_attr(DMA_ATTR_WEAK_ORDERING, &imem->attrs);
818 dma_set_attr(DMA_ATTR_WRITE_COMBINE, &imem->attrs);
819 dma_set_attr(DMA_ATTR_NO_KERNEL_MAPPING, &imem->attrs);
820 imem->cpu_map = gk20a_instobj_cpu_map_dma;
821
822 nvkm_info(&imem->base.subdev, "using DMA API\n");
823 }
824#endif
825
826 return 0;
827}
